ai.summary: Lime Kiln Walk is a short, scenic ridge hike along Wenlock Edge in Shropshire, England. At about 2.2 km, the easy route follows rolling limestone escarpments with views across the countryside and passes historic lime kilns along the way.
ai.terrain_summary: Flat to gently undulating ridge path with a limestone surface. Occasional rocky sections and exposed edges; moss and mud possible after rain. Good footwear recommended; remote sections mean pace is relaxed and exposure varies with wind.
ai.safety_notes: Parts of Wenlock Edge are exposed; check the weather and wind before starting. Stay on the marked path, keep a safe distance from cliff edges, and supervise children or dogs. Wear sturdy footwear, bring a warm layer and waterproof, and carry a map or trusted navigation device. Mobile signal can be limited in upland areas; carry a fully charged phone and share your plan with someone.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline GPS
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October), though the route can be hiked year-round in dry conditions.
